COLLEGES STUDYING SOVIET TELEVISION
description: RUSSIAN newscasts, Slavic cultural and sporting events and even exercise shows are transforming the way college students are studying the Soviet Union.

title: Mafia Links To Union Cited
description: A government informer testified yesterday that a criminal associate told him in 1979 that a faction of the Lucchese crime family had taken control of two teamster union locals at Kennedy International Airport.

Wages of Cynicism
description: The experts - some Americans, allies and most probably Russians too - are beginning to reap the wages of cynicism. For almost as long as there have been nuclear arsenals, various leaders have toyed with a hopeful public, offering to wipe out weapons and remove threats.

title: South Africa Miners In First Day of Strike
description: Thousands of black gold-mine workers today entered the first full day of a strike over wage proposals after earlier clashes with mine security forces.

title: COMPAQ COMPUTER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
East German Swims to West
description: A 49-year-old East German, wearing a wet suit, swam the Spree River to freedom in West Berlin today. A police spokesman in West Berlin said the swimmer was greeted by passers-by as he climbed from the river, which forms part of the border between the eastern and western sectors of Berlin.

title: PARIS, BONN WARNED ON PHONE BID
description: The Reagan Administration is warning France and West Germany that their telecommunications industries may be excluded from the United States market if they block the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's bid to buy C.G.C.T., the telecommunications maker controlled by the French Government.

title: Detroit Utility Deal For Reactor Stake
description: The Detroit Edison Company said it would buy out a minority owner of its trouble-plagued Fermi 2 nuclear power plant for $550 million in 1990, leaving the seller with $200 million in Federally guaranteed debt from the project. The Wolverine Power Supply Cooperative holds 12.5 percent of the Fermi plant, down from 20 percent when it got involved in the late 1970's.

title: TEXAS AIR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary tax credit of $18.5 million for the quarter and 9 months. c-After extraordinary tax credits of $32,140,000 for the quarter and $56,284,000 for the 9 months.

title: PARTNERSHIP BUYOUT BY GENENTECH
description: Genentech Inc., the San Francisco-based biotechnology company, said yesterday that it would buy two of its research partnerships that have sponsored the development of three highly promising drugs: growth hormone, interferon and a blood clot dissolver.

title: KREMLIN RESUMES ISSUING KEY DATA
description: After years of withholding data on child mortality, the Soviet Union has resumed publishing figures on this key social indicator.

title: SOVIET LETS U.S. LAWYER HELP 5 JEWS
description: An American lawyer said here today that he had been allowed to speak up on behalf of five Jews who were arrested late Saturday for disturbing the peace during an noisy holiday celebration on the street outside the Moscow Synagogue.

title: MILITARY CONTRACTOR IS FINED $5.2 MILLION
description: C3 Inc., a small Virginia-based supplier of computer systems, agreed today to pay $5.2 million in fines to settle criminal and civil charges of fraudulent overcharges arising from a 1977 Army contract.

title: Bonn Records Large Surplus
description: West Germany recorded a monthly trade surplus of $5.1 billion in September, its second largest ever after a $5.3 billion surplus in July, boosting the trade surplus in the first nine months beyond 1985's full-year results.

title: HETEROSEXUALS AND AIDS: THE CONCERN IS GROWING
description: HEADING off the proliferation of AIDS among heterosexuals has begun to preoccupy many health officials, who recognize that past ignorance and inertia allowed the fatal disease to course through the populations of homosexual men and intravenous drug users with devastating effect.

description: Parade of Champions

description: Sweden is offering $250 million of 8 1/2 percent bonds at a price of 99.83, to yield 8.15 percent. The underwriters are led by Salomon Brothers Inc.

description: The price of live cattle futures jumped today as a new Agriculture Department report showed a smaller-than-expected increase in beef production in the third quarter.

description: b-After a writedown of $725,000 of the company's oil and gas reserves.

title: COOPER INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
PRIAM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income and includes a tax credit of $115,000.

title: GULCH LOSES EDGE AFTER LOSS
description: A few weeks ago, it looked like the one cinch on the Breeders' Cup card would be Gulch in the Juvenile. The 2-year-old son of Mr. Prospector had toyed with his opposition in New York while winning his first five starts and four major stakes races.

title: HICKAM, DOW B INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
A Power Behind Offer For BankAmerica
description: For many years Richard C. Blum has been a behind-the-scenes power in San Francisco, not the least of the reasons being his marriage to Mayor Dianne Feinstein. But Mr. Blum's name hit the headlines this weekend with the news that he had made a proposal to raise $1 billion to try to help save the ailing BankAmerica Corporation.

title: EXECUTIVES
description: * Econo Lodges of America, Charlotte, N.C., named Clarence Johnson senior vice president of franchise development.

title: PAYCO AMERICAN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Dow Up 9.56, Spurred by Goodyear
description: Stock prices inched higher yesterday on Wall Street, but once again the attention of investors focused mainly on takeovers and restructurings.

title: So That's It
description: Rufus Bess of the Minnesota Vikings, who lost to the Cleveland Browns despite gaining twice as much yardage in total offense: ''They didn't do anything special, except for the special teams. I guess that's why they call them the special teams.''

title: Tiebreakers Through the Years
description: Here is how teams fared, in seven categories, in the seventh and deciding game of 29 previous World Series:

title: FANS CELEBRATE, BUT IN STANDS
description: For the Mets, it was the sweetest of victories. For the fans, it was ''the greatest thing of all time.'' And for the police, it was a show of force, and of horse, that kept the postgame celebration jubilant but mostly in the stands.

title: President's Executive Order Imposes Pretoria Sanctions
description: President Reagan signed an executive order today putting economic sanctions into effect against South Africa.

title: BUSH INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
NEVADA SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
A Media Man Is Sick of Politics: Charles Guggenheim
description: Charles Guggenheim is an old-timer in the campaign consulting industry.

title: 'STAR WARS' TRACED TO EISENHOWER ERA
description: THE quest for ways to shoot down enemy missiles, the goal of President Reagan's ''Star Wars'' plan, is more than a quarter century old, a review of 1950's documents and recently declassified materials show. President Eisenhower began it all in the late 1950's when he embarked on a crash program of research that eventually cost billions of dollars and involved thousands of the nation's best scientists.

title: Break the Fighter Plane Monopoly
description: Air Force Secretary Edward Aldridge is expected to decide this week whether to order 318 F-16 air defense fighter planes from General Dynamics, or to take a flyer on the new F-20 offered by Northrop. The decision will test the Air Force's commitment to competition. The two planes are comparable in performance and price, but buying F-20's will dent General Dynamics's monopoly of affordable fighter planes.

title: DEXTER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes a $2.5 million charge from disposal of product line at Life Technologies Inc. in which Dexter owns a 62 percent stake. Share earnings are restated to reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid Oct. 10.

title: Navy Ends Last Litton Suspension
description: The Navy lifted the last of its suspensions against Litton Industries, allowing a subsidiary that had figured in a Federal fraud case to resume bidding for military contracts. The Navy, in a prepared statement, said it was lifting the suspension against Litton's Clifton Precision division because the corporation had agreed to a series of corrective actions and extensive Government monitoring for the next five years.

title: Religion and Politics
description: ''Ever think about what's important to you? It's probably simple - a steady job, a healthy family and a personal relationship with Christ. That's the easy part.''

title: RED SOX FAITHFUL SUFFERING AGAIN
description: The giant figure 1 still shone from the Prudential Insurance Company tower opposite Fenway Park tonight, but there was no joy in Beantown.

title: JAPANESE ACCUSED ON CHIP PACT
description: The early experience under a three-month-old agreement between the United States and Japan to protect American semiconductor manufacturers has been one of ''outright violations'' by Japanese companies, the Semiconductor Industry Association said today.

title: THOUSANDS OF WORKERS WALK OUT AT 26 MEDICAL CENTERS
description: More than 9,000 workers in the Kaiser Permanente Medical Care Program in California went on strike today after failing to reach an agreement over Kaiser's demand for separate wage systems for new and old employees.

title: Advertising; Mingo-Jones Partner Quits, Forms Own Firm
description: Caroline R. Jones has resigned as partner and creative director of Mingo-Jones Advertising to form her own communications firm, Creative Resources Management, which will specialize in promotion and marketing.

title: The Two Wars Of Tom Waddell
description: Tom Waddell, who placed sixth in the 1968 Olympic decathlon and helped found the Gay Games in San Francisco four years ago, is fighting two battles these days. He has high hopes of winning one - an appeal to the Supreme Court of decisions siding with the United States Olympic Committee, which has prohibited the Gay Games from using the designation ''Gay Olympics.''

title: NEAR-DEATH EXPERIENCES ILLUMINATE DYING ITSELF
description: THE mystery of death haunts the living, but real understanding of it has always proved elusive.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: BRINTEC CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes an extraordinary gain of $955,000.

title: Resto, Lewis Sentenced
description: Luis Resto, a former junior-middleweight boxer, and Carlos (Panama) Lewis, his manager and trainer, were sentenced to prison yesterday for their roles in a glove-tampering incident growing out of Resto's victory over Billy Collins Jr. in June 1983 in Madison Square Garden.

title: Chess: Ljubojevich Wins Tourney Without Incurring One Loss
description: It is not easy to combine creativity and steadiness, but that is what Ljubomir Ljubojevic did in the OHRA International Tournament in Amsterdam. The 35-year-old Yugoslav grandmaster not only played the most exciting games of the event, but was also not nicked for a loss on his way to his winning 6 1/2-3 1/2 score and the first prize of 10,000 guilders, or about $4,400.

title: Two Issues for New Yorkers; Continuing The War On Drugs
description: When the 99th Congress concluded on Oct. 18, New Yorkers could take pride in many of its accomplishments, including strict sanctions against the racist Pretoria regime, tax reform that preserved state and local income and property tax deductions and the continued vitality of programs ranging from student loans to senior citizen housing to mass transportation assistance.

title: Advertising; People
description: * Harold L. Scutt Jr. has been promoted to general manager and named to the board of DDB Needham New York.

title: UNION CARBIDE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes a loss from discontinued operations of $4 million and reflects the $252 million gain from the disposal of businesses, primarily the sale of the home and automotive products business. c-Includes income from discontinued operations of $605 million, which includes a gain of $588 million from the disposal of discontinued operations, and a gain of $270 million from cumulative effect of an accounting change. d-Net loss and includes income from discontinued operations of $32 million, a special charge of $620 million relating to the company's 1985 restructuring program and a gain of $19 million from the repurchase of debentures. e-Net loss and includes unusual charges of $736 million, a loss from discontinued operations of $103 million and a gain of $19 million from repurchase of debentures. The results for 1985 have been restated.

title: Q & A
description: Q.Is a pumpkin a fruit or a vegetable? A.Botanically, a pumpkin is a fruit because it arises from the flowering portion of a plant and contains seeds, according to Dr. Gerald Dull of the Department of Agriculture Research Service in Athens, Ga. Practically, however, a pumpkin is normally served as a vegetable because it is not very sweet, he said.

title: ATLANTIC RICHFIELD CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After about $30 million after-tax charge reflecting the net effect of a gain on the sale of various chemical assets that previously were targeted for divestiture, and a favorable adjustment of about $11 million after-tax from the adoption of new pension accounting. c-Net loss and after a loss of $535 million from discontinued operations. The company said the year-ago 9-month includes the effect of a $1.5 billion after-tax charge taken in the second quarter.

title: U.S. OFFICIAL BACKS MOSCOW'S VERSION OF REAGAN STAND
description: A senior White House official said today that he ''would not quarrel'' with the Soviet contention that President Reagan had endorsed Mikhail S. Gorbachev's proposal for banning all offensive strategic forces by 1996, and not just ballistic missiles.

title: GTI CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Plants Heat Up
description: At dusk, their prime time for pollination, a group of tropical flowering plants literally become hot. An ecologist working in the forests of Costa Rica found that the flowers of at least seven plant species heated up more than 40 degrees Fahrenheit in one hour.

title: Jets' Mehl Sidelined For Up to 6 Weeks
description: The Jets may have been the most resilient team in the first half of the National Football League season, but now they will have to stretch even further.

title: In Surprise Move, Chief Resigns at Hartmarx
description: In a surprise announcement, Richard P. Hamilton, the 55-year-old chairman and chief executive of the Hartmarx Corporation, said yesterday that he was resigning. The announcement comes on the heels of a massive restructuring of the apparel manufacturer and retailing company, whose brands include Hickey-Freeman, Jaeger and Pierre Cardin.

title: Reliance Subsidiary Buys Lomas Stake
description: A subsidiary of Reliance Group, the New York-based insurance holding company that is controlled by New York financier Saul P. Steinberg, said that it has acquired a 6.5 percent stake in Lomas & Nettleton Financial Corporation for $58.3 million. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the subsidiary, Reliance Financial Services Corporation, said it purchased the Lomas shares ''for investment,'' as part of its general portfolio.

title: HEALTHCARE SERVICES GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
MINE SAFETY APPLIANCES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
DANCE: HONI COLES STEPS OUT IN 'SALUTE TO SWING'
description: CHARLES (HONI) COLES is an experienced charmer and one of the great tap-dancers performing today. Tall, dapper and thin as a knife blade, he saunters onto a stage and fills it with his feathery virtuoso tap-dancing. And Mr. Coles was true to form on Sunday afternoon at Town Hall, when he appeared as a guest star in String Fever's ''Salute to Swing.''

title: REPORT SEEKS REMOVAL OF EHRLICH AS CONSERVATOR FOR MAN'S ESTATE
description: A court-appointed referee has called for the removal of Bernard G. Ehrlich, a former National Guard commander, as conservator of the estate of a 92-year-old man and said the man's estate lost more than $250,000 in value in nine months.

title: TEXT OF VATICAN CHRONOLOGY OF THE SEATTLE DISPUTE
description: Following is the text of a Vatican statement mailed to all bishops in the United States on its actions involving the Archbishop of Seattle:

title: Novel Combustion
description: A group of Soviet chemists has reported the discovery of a new kind of combustion: a ''liquid flame'' in which the process of burning organizes itself into a glowing molten ball instead of a gas.

title: Mathias Joining Jones, Day
description: The law firm of Jones, Day, Reavis & Pogue said yesterday that Senator Charles McC.

title: 'My Position Hasn't Changed'
description: ''My position hasn't changed,'' William von Raab said of his opinion of Mexican law enforcement. What is that position? On March 7, in an interview with The New York Times, he said the Mexican Government was ''inept and corrupt, up and down the ladder - my policy is to assume everyone is corrupt unless I learn otherwise.''

title: MAKING THE LEAP FROM LAOS TO BRONX
description: As a ceremony on Ellis Island yesterday was honoring 80 ethnic Americans who had already made it - the Muhammad Alis and the Victor Borges, the people a nation knows first-hand - a Laotian immigrant named Khonpoum Sone was sitting in English class at a Y.M.C.A.

title: HEART FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: There were no year-ago share earnings available; the company went public in December 1985.

title: Richard Woodruff Dies at 54; Model for 'Big Boy' Statues
description: Richard Woodruff, whose chubby appearance is said to have inspired the statues that welcome diners to Big Boy restaurants coast to coast, died last Monday at North Hollywood Medical Center following a long illness.

title: COMMITTEES PREPARE NEGATIVE TACTICS IN HOUSE RACES
description: Both the Democratic and Republican Congressional campaign committees have prepared last-minute negative tactics for use in key contests for the House of Representatives.

title: Debt Ratings Cut At Republicbank
description: The Republicbank Corporation's debt ratings were reduced yesterday, the Standard & Poor's Corporation announced.

title: Babe Ruth Curse Strikes Again
description: Enos Slaughter ran all the way home again last night. Jim Lonborg's arm was still tired on two days' rest. Joe Morgan slapped a hit off Jim Burton. Bucky Dent's fly ball once again soared over the left-field fence.

title: LINEAR FILMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
TEXTRON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes an extraordinary charge of $6.7 million for both the quarter and 9 months and net from discontinued operations of $8 million and $9.2 million for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Includes net from discontinued operations of $13.7 million and an extraordinary credit of $16.4 million. d-Includes net from discontinued operations of $29.5 million, an extraordinary credit of $16.4 million and a credit of $11.8 million from an accounting change.

title: LUBRIZOL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes a gain of 5 cents a share from sale of investments for the quarter and 9 months. c-Includes a gain of 27 cents a share from the sale of investments.

title: A CLASH OF WILLS AT KROGER KROGER AFTER RESTRUCTURING
description: William G. Kagler, the hard-driving president of the Kroger Company, has impatiently pushed the food retailer in the last few years to adapt to a more competitive industry. Apparently, he pushed a little too hard.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: TUESDAY, OCTOBER 28, 1986
description: The Economy

title: ETHIOPIA'S FOREIGN MINISTER, CONSIDERED A MODERATE, QUITS
description: The Foreign Minister of Ethiopia announced here today that he was resigning to protest what he called his country's authoritarianism and dictatorship.

title: NEW YORK CITY JOINS SUSTAINED U.S. PUSH TO IMPROVE SCHOOLS
description: Five years after most of the country, New York City has begun to address the quality of its public schools.

title: MATH + SEXISM: A PROBLEM
description: THOSE who are keeping a tally of the many ways sexist thinking has blocked the march of progress may now want to add one more: the Menage Problem.

title: Emerson to Buy Hazeltine Corp.
description: The Emerson Electric Company plans to acquire the Hazeltine Corporation, a Long Island military contractor that employs 2,300 workers, for $30 a share, or $189.1 million, the companies announced.

title: HYTEK MICROSYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: INDAL LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
MUSIC: LES ARTS FLORISSANTS
description: SUNDAY evening's American debut of the French early-music ensemble Les Arts Florissants attracted the cream of New York's own performing and scholarly early-music community. The Medieval Sculpture Court of the Metropolitan Museum of Art was filled with this knowledgeable audience, which gave every sign of appreciating a most refined and pleasurable program.

title: KIMMINS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss The name of the company was changed from Kimmins Industrial Service Corp., effective Tuesday, Oct. 21.

title: KENJI OSANO
description: Kenji Osano, a confidant of former Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka who was convicted of perjury in connection with the Lockheed payoff scandal, died of an ulcer early today at Toranomon Hospital, doctors said. He was 69 years old.

title: CITY OPERA: 'DIE FLEDERMAUS'
description: MOST of the major roles in the New York City Opera's current run of ''Die Fledermaus'' changed hands on Sunday night. Leigh Munro as the new Adele fit right in with the City Opera's glitzy, not too subtle, look at Johann Strauss's great masterpiece.

title: AYDIN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
MIDWAY AIRLINES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: BOEING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the 1986 share earnings calculation is based on 155,518,592 shares.

title: CREDIT CHANGES LOOM IN NEW INTEREST CURBS
description: The way many Americans borrow money to finance everything from college educations to refrigerators is likely to change under the new tax law as interest deductions become subject to new restrictions.

title: ONCE AGAIN, BRITISH JOURNAL IS SHAKING UP THE LEFT
description: ''Earthquakes in Japan, famines in China, revolutions in Mexico?'' George Orwell wrote in barely suppressed outrage over British insularity. ''Don't worry, the milk will be on the doorstep tomorrow morning'' and ''the New Statesman will come out on Friday.''

title: G.E. Chip Units
description: The General Electric Company is looking to sell its semiconductor operations, according to The Electronic News. The weekly trade newspaper reported that G. E. had approached Motorola Inc., Oki Electric Company of Japan and Siemens of West Germany as potential buyers of its Intersil Inc. subsidiary in Cupertino, Calif., and the solid state operations of the RCA Corporation, which was acquired by G.E.

description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $2 million for the quarter and $711,000 for the 9 months.

INCO LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: There were no share earnings for the latest periods after preferred dividend requirements. Inco said gains for the latest periods from sale of securities, retirement of long-term debt and currency translation adjustments were $4 million for the third quarter and $15 million for the 9 months, compared with $12 million and $35 million for the year- earlier periods, respectively. The latest quarter and 9 months results also include shutdown costs of $10 million and $22 million, respectively, compared with costs of $9 million and $12 million for the comparable year-ago periods, respectively. All figures are in U.S. currency.

title: RLI CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes realized investment gains of $258,118 and $263,880 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Includes realized investment gains of $64,236 and $137,919 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: LEARNING BY ROTE
description: THE R-bbit is the chief villain in a new critique of the way children are taught.

title: TAX CHANGES HURT GENTLEMAN FARMERS
description: In 1970, Paul and Clara Kellner, the owners of Better Cravats, a successful necktie manufacturing company in New York City's garment district, counted themselves among the first of Manhattan's privileged couples to buy and operate a farm in Columbia County. Since then, many more high-income business executives and attorneys have snapped up farms in this magnificent Hudson River Valley county at prices often in excess of $1 million.

title: INSIDE
description: Sherman Adams Dead at 87 Sherman Adams, President Eisenhower's chief assistant, who resigned under fire for accepting gifts from a favor-seeker, died.

title: Burned in Iceland
description: Reykjavik produced a roller coaster, first of hope, then disappointment and now confusion. After two weeks the world is still left to wonder: On which lofty goals did President Reagan and Mikhail Gorbachev actually agree?

title: Market Place; Hanson Profile Rising in U.S.
description: NEXT Monday, the stock of Hanson Trust P.L.C., the conglomerate based in Britain, will begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange. In itself, the event is rather routine. Hanson will simply be joining a number of other large British companies that decided in recent years to expand their shareholder base by tapping the American market.

title: ASARCO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: A Deliberate Delay?
description: Some Democrats in Congress and environmentalists are complaining that the Secretary of the Senate, who works for the Republican leader, Senator Bob Dole, deliberately delayed sending Clean Water legislation to the White House so President Reagan would not have to veto it before Election Day next Tuesday. The Democrats, including Representative James J. Howard of New Jersey, say a veto of the popular legislation might have cost Republican candidates votes if it occurred before the election.

title: COSTS OF LIFE IN COLONIES
description: NESTING in colonies exposes swallow offspring to egg-eating snakes and infestation by parasites, but a biologist who has closely studied the birds has concluded that such disadvantages are outweighed by the colony's adults' increased ability to exchange information on food sources.

title: VIEWPOINTS: 3 FASHION CAPITALS
description: All over Europe, fashion designers are switching from clothes like sausage wrappings to the diametrical opposite: bouffant or puffy skirts buoyed by myriad petticoats. These full styles, stopping at midthigh, can be as inappropriate as the tightly swaddled styles they are replacing. They combine the miniskirts of the 1960's with the crinolines of the 1950's in a way that has little to do with life in the 1980's.

title: 'BAD GUYS' FULFILL IMAGE AND PROMISE
description: Dave Johnson was as happy as he was wet.

title: FIRST FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN CHARLESTON reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
ASTROCOM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
2 TIGHT-END SETUP HELPS GIANTS WIN
description: In a game of superlatives, a few little wrinkles came in handy for the Giants. One of them, a two tight end set that they had not shown before, went a long way toward helping them beat the Washington Redskins tonight, 27-20, and create a three-way tie for the lead in the Eastern Division of the National Football Conference.

title: FOOD NOTES
description: Surprising French Foods About a million square feet of exhibition space in a new industrial park area north of Paris near Charles de Gaulle Airport were devoted last week to the biennial food show for the trade, Le Salon International de l'Alimentation. Exhibitors came from 68 countries, including Bangladesh, Ethiopia, Iceland, Poland and the United States, but not the Soviet Union; two-thirds of the exhibits were French.

title: VATICAN GUIDELINE ON HOMOSEXUALS
description: New Vatican guidelines for Roman Catholic pastors will recommend that homosexuals be encouraged to practice the sacraments and that psychological and medical factors should be taken into account in assisting them, senior church officials said today.

title: BID RAISED FOR WEST COAST BANK
description: The First Interstate Bancorp increased its bid today to buy the troubled BankAmerica Corporation and asked the bank's board to respond to the offer shortly after its meeting next Monday.

title: MUSIC: ECLECTIX! GROUP
description: THE chamber orchestra Eclectix! (the exclamation point is part of the ensemble's name) presented a program entitled ''Daring to be Tonal!'' (the exclamation point is part of the name of the program) at CAMI Hall Monday night.

title: USX LOSES $183 MILLION IN QUARTER
description: The USX Corporation, which has been battered by both a three-month work stoppage at its steel plants and declining oil prices, reported a third-quarter loss yesterday of $183 million. In contrast, the company earned $144 million, or 46 cents a share, a year ago.

title: Continental Finds Chief at American
description: Thomas G. Plaskett, a key executive at American Airlines Inc., has been named president and chief executive of the Continental Airlines Corporation, Continental announced yesterday.

title: Robert Brenner Dead; Advocate of Car Safety
description: Dr. Robert Brenner, who spent most of his professional life as an advocate of improved automobile safety, died of cancer Saturday at his home in Gaithersburg, Md. He was 64 years old.

title: WACKENHUT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes an after-tax gain of $684,000, or 18 cents a share, from the sale of a former headquarters building.

title: SCRIPPS HOWARD BROADCASTNG reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
JWT Group's Profits Drop 38.6% in Quarter
description: JWT Group yesterday reported that its net income for the third quarter declined 38.6 percent, to $2.7 million, or 29 cents a share, from $4.4 million, or 47 cents a share, in the year-ago quarter, while revenues increased 10 percent, to $149 million, from $136 million.

title: BANKS OF MID-AMERICA reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income and after an extraordinary credit of $297,000. The per share earnings are fully diluted.

title: A SCHOOL TO SIMON'S LIKING
description: The University of Rochester, in a show of entrepreneurial spirit, has lined up a new name, a new benefactor and a new game plan.

title: Destiny, Free Will and the Mets
description: Though the New York Mets' final victory was sweet, Game Seven of the 1986 World Series will not endure in memory as long as Game Six, when the Mets rose from their deathbed, again. Davey Johnson's crew are champions because in the playoffs and then in the Series, they simply refused to be buried. The city's celebration of their championship may not rank as the grandest in a year of grand civic celebrations, but it may be the most memorable.

title: KELLY SERVICES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
VTX ELECTRONICS reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
CORRECTION
description: A Washington dispatch on Thursday about worldwide drug trafficking misstated the period during which a State Department report said drug production increased in Mexico. Although the report found large increases in marijuana and opium production in Mexico, the finding was based on revised official figures for 1985 compared with those of previous years, not on figures for 1986.

title: ONE VALLEY BANCORP OF W VA reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
For the Senate From New York
description: The fund-raiser, with Senator Edward Kennedy as the celebrity speaker, sounded like a high point of Mark Green's campaign to unseat Republican Senator Alfonse D'Amato. Senator Kennedy did his best one day last week to make it that. He spoke with feeling, likening Mr. Green to ''past champions of progressive causes from New York like Wagner, Javits, Moynihan - and Bob Kennedy.'' But it was no high point. Apart from staff, journalists, Senator Kennedy and the candidate, there were nine people in the room.

title: ENVIRONMENTAL TREATMENT & TECHNOLOGIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $276,000. c-Includes tax credits of $422,000 and $1,115,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: U.S. LIKELY TO CUT GUARANTEED RATE FOR SAVINGS BONDS
description: The Government, moving to end a windfall enjoyed by millions of small investors, is expected to announce a substantial cut Wednesday in the guaranteed 7 1/2 percent interest rate on United States savings bonds.

title: Bomb Report On East Side
description: A device resembling a pipe bomb that was found in a Park Avenue building and an unrelated fire at the same time in an adjacent building brought the police bomb squad and about 100 firefighters to the scene yesterday afternoon, officials said.

title: Touching Base
description: The Rev. Robert M. Hemstreet is not exactly taking credit for the Mets' victory over the Red Sox, but as the minister of the Universalist Unitarian Church in Flushing, not far from Shea Stadium, he did his best. With New York down by one game to none, Mr. Hemstreet used his morning services on Sunday, Oct. 19, to address ''A Prayer for the 1986 World Series'' to the ''Master/Mistress of all our games, Rulemaker of the cosmos.''

title: Market Place; A Turn to Cash At No. 1 Fund
description: THE third quarter of 1986 was treacherous for money managers. Standard & Poor's 500-stock index produced a negative return of 6.97 percent. The period included the worst single-day point drop for the Dow Jones industrial average - a free fall of 86.61 points on Sept. 11. And all summer long, portfolio managers worried over the economy, interest rates, deflation and the tax bill.

title: SOUTHINGTON SAVINGS reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company converted to the stock form from the mutual form on July 3, 1986.

title: STOCKER & YALE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings reflect 100-percent stock dividend paid in August.

title: PUBLIC BROADCASTERS CANCEL GUBERNATORIAL TV DEBATE
description: New York State's public broadcasting stations yesterday canceled the only live television debate of the gubernatorial campaign, deciding instead to air separate interviews with each of the four candidates.

title: The Lessons of Reykjavik
description: President Reagan and General Secretary Gorbachev are still differing about what they said to one another at Reykjavik, which is odd because a record of sorts was kept there of their conversations.

title: INTERNATIONAL INCOME PROPRTY INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: PERSONAL HEALTH
description: CORONARY heart disease is rarely thought of as a youthful affliction, but this disease, which kills more Americans than any other, has its roots in the dietary and other habits - sedentary living and smoking among them - adopted during childhood and adolescence. By age 4, the average American child has already reached a serum cholesterol level that is as high as it should be in adulthood if coronary arteries are to remain unclogged by fatty deposits. About 30 percent of the nation's youngsters have cholesterol levels that most experts consider abnormally high, levels likely to grow increasingly worse when the children become adults.

title: Hill & Knowlton Reorganizing U.S. Units
description: Hill & Knowlton, the public relations subsidiary of the JWT Group will organize its domestic operations into a centrally managed unit, Hill and Knowlton USA.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''Wow! I've never been in a parade before.'' - Lenny Dykstra. [ B14:5. ]

title: COMMERCIAL METALS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
Kerr-McGee Posts a Loss
description: The Kerr-McGee Corporation, a diversified energy concern, reported yesterday that it lost $325.8 million in the third quarter, primarily because of $315 million in after-tax, non-cash charges.

title: ADS ARE THE ISSUE IN FLORIDA IN HAWKINS-GRAHAM RACE
description: Even Charles Black, Paula Hawkins's chief strategist, who likes to compare her to Joan of Arc, concedes that the Florida Senator ''didn't have a totally good week'' last week.

title: LIBERTY FOUNDATION CHIEF FAULTS MARKETING OF EVENT
description: The president of the private foundation in charge of rebuilding the Statue of Liberty and part of Ellis Island said yesterday that tickets to the Liberty Weekend celebration last July were overpriced and poorly marketed.

title: Associated Dry Goods Gets Fourth Resignation
description: A fourth former top executive of the Associated Dry Goods Corporation has resigned after the recent acquisition of Associated by the May Department Stores Company.

title: CONCERT: CENTENNIAL HOMAGE TO VILLA-LOBOS AT TULLY
description: HEITOR VILLA-LOBOS, the subject of a lively centennial concert Monday night at Alice Tully Hall put on by the Brazilian Cultural Foundation, began life as a free-spirited avant-gardist with a strong interest in the exotic music of his native land. A darling of the Parisian avant-garde in the 1920's, he later worked productively to revamp musical education in Brazil and to steer composers there toward native traditions, and spent the final years of his life - he died in 1959 - as an admired international music celebrity.

title: U.S. SAID TO LIMIT VISIT OF RUSSIANS
description: Five Soviet scientists who will arrive in the United States Nov. 9 to discuss sites in Nevada and California that have been proposed for monitoring American nuclear tests will be limited to a stay of one week, a private environmental group announced yesterday.

title: CULLEN/FROST BANKERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Penn Central To Sell Units
description: The Penn Central Corporation yesterday announced a series of transactions involving the sale and public offering of most of its energy-related businesses.

title: Reliance Subsidiary To Buy WNJU-TV
description: A unit of the Reliance Group said yesterday that it had agreed to acquire WNJU-TV/Channel 47, the highest-rated Spanish-language television station in the New York area, for $70 million from a group including Norman Lear, the producer, and other investors.

title: GLOBAL MARINE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the latest third quarter and 9-month losses are after a writedown of $9 million on the value of certain oil and gas properties for both the quarter and 9 months, and a $40 million expense on the termination of its lease on a rig for the quarter and $92 million writedown of a rig and oil and gas properties for the 9 months.

title: ANALOGIC CORP reports earnings for Year to July 31
description: Share earnings are restated to reflect the results of 3H Industries, acquired in May.

title: 'YADDO,' ARTISTS' RETREAT
description: WE should all have a Yaddo in our lives -bosky glens, free food, peace and quiet. The artists' retreat may not always stimulate great art, but certainly it's a wonderful place to hang out. It is the subject of a pleasant half-hour documentary, ''Yaddo,'' on Channel 13 at 11:30 tonight.

title: BRAINTREE SAVINGS BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Braintree did not give per share earnings; a second public offering in July made the figures imcomparable.

title: STEPAN COMPANY reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
2 BOMBS EXPLODE AT MILITARY SITES IN PUERTO RICO AND 8 ARE DISARMED
description: One person was injured by one of two bombs that exploded in Puerto Rico early today, and the police and the Federal authorities disarmed eight other bombs placed outside recruiting stations and military installations on the island.

title: WILD EDIBLES ADD EXOTIC TOUCH TO MENU
description: FORAGING has returned to America. Wild edibles, once poor folks' means of survival, are appearing as new luxury items on menus of innovative and exclusive restaurants throughout the country. In states such as Washington, California, New Mexico, Colorado, Michigan and New York, restaurateurs are carefully cultivating relationships with a network of foragers who provide them with seasonal ingredients harvested in the wild.

title: DSC COMMUNICATIONS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes an extraordinary gain of $2,913,000 from the repurchase of debentures for both the quarter and 9 months. c-Net loss d-After a loss of $13,718,000 from an accounting change.

title: WARWICK INSURANCE MANAGERS reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes realized investment gains of $86,390 and $566,585 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Includes realized investment gains of $14,678 for the quarter, and realized investment gains of $108,798 and a tax credit of $304,000 for the 9 months.

title: INQUIRY SEEN AS PERILING LAROUCHE HOLDINGS
description: The financial holdings of Lyndon H. LaRouche Jr. have been threatened by a Federal investigation of the conspiracy theorist's secretive fund-raising efforts, according to law-enforcement officials.

title: Gould Names Chairman
description: James F. McDonald, chief executive of Gould Inc., the electronics and information systems maker, has been named to the additional position of chairman. Mr. McDonald, 46 years old, replaces William T. Ylvisaker, who resigned last month after Gould announced the sale of its $400 million military unit. During Mr. Ylvisaker's 17 years as chairman, Gould was transformed from a manufacturing company into a technology firm. Mr. McDonald, a former executive at the International Business Machines Corporation joined Gould as president in 1984 and was named chief executive last April.

title: BEVERLY SAVINGS BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The per share earnings are not available. The bank went public last month.

title: CILCORP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
ROLLINS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
BACARDI CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $1,243,000. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $306,000 and $2,553,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectivley.

title: FIRST SECURITY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Overload Halts London Trades
description: The London Stock Exchange today again suffered a technical failure, after a computer breakdown on Monday that marred the start of the new era of computerized share-trading here.

title: MUSIC: BEAUX ARTS TRIO
description: ONE of the most interesting about-faces in contemporary music has been George Rochberg's return from the farthest outposts of Serial music to the well-settled world of traditional harmony. One is tempted to call it a retreat, but so sure and original is Mr. Rochberg's ''old-fashioned'' - if new-found - voice that this supposed step backward seems almost a plunge into the avant-garde.

title: LIZ CLAIBORNE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
THE STAGE: 'CARNIVAL!'
description: ''CARNIVAL!,'' the 1961 hit musical about an angelic waif who attaches herself to a poor traveling circus, is a Gallic fable that needs just the right blend of ''Cinderella''-style romance and robust razzle-dazzle to avoid seeming foolishly childish. In the show's spirited revival at the Goodspeed Opera House, in East Haddam, Conn., ''Carnival!'' erupts with ebullient rough-and-tumble merriment. But the central love story of an innocent orphan girl and the embittered puppeteer who woos her by speaking through the voices of his hand-puppet characters, is played out with a stiff, wary self-consciousness that robs the show of much of its romantic charm.

title: 'BABY M' STUDY LAUDS COUPLES
description: Both couples battling for custody of the infant born to a surrogate mother and known as ''Baby M'' would make adequate parents, according to a court-ordered probation officer's report.

title: REAGAN, ON SOUTHERN TRIP, CALLS DEMOCRATS SPENDTHRIFT
description: President Reagan, seeking to retain Republican control of the Senate, stepped up his attacks on the Democratic Party today as spendthrift, weak on the military and soft on criminal justice.

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: Israeli Nurses on Strike
description: The Israeli Health Ministry ordered all hospitals to institute emergency measures today as a sixth day of partial walkouts by nurses further weakened the health system. The nurses returned to the wards this morning after a 24-hour walkout, only to leave most units again during the afternoon shift.

title: THE U.N. TODAY: OCT. 29, 1986
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Meets at 10 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: OWNING REAL ESTATE: THE NEW TAX OUTLOOK
description: From skyscrapers in Manhattan to rental condos in Miami Beach, the new tax law cuts deeply into the tax benefits that have long made real estate a highly rewarding investment for both the rich and the not-so-rich.

title: 4 JOCKEY FOR PLACE AS RIVALS TO KOCH
description: Four potential rivals to Mayor Koch already have emerged at City Hall, creating a new disharmony in municipal government as they regularly clash with Mr. Koch and occasionally with each other.

title: MARGA KLOMPE
description: Marga Klompe, the first female Cabinet minister in the Netherlands, died today, the Government announced.

title: WHITE WINS BLACK SUPPORT IN DETROIT
description: On a recent Sunday, Mayor Coleman A. Young toured churches on Detroit's east side, trying to persuade their all-black congregations that they should vote for a white suburbanite for Governor rather than a black resident of the inner city.

title: LIFE IN THE 30'S
description: ROBERT called me ''baby'' the other night.

title: Vernacular U.S. Classics Reissued
description: RHYTHM-AND-BLUES and 50's-vintage rock-and-roll, the music that spread American pop culture around the world, has been more widely available in Europe and Japan than here at home for 15 years or more.

title: Fame Nominations
description: Among the 11 men nominated for the Basketball Hall of Fame yesterday were the former Knicks guards Walt Frazier and Earl Monroe.

title: Isolate Syria
description: The conviction in London of Nezar Hindawi for an attempt to blow up an Israeli airliner should provide the occasion to inaugurate a new relationship between the West and the leading sponsor of terror in the Middle East and Europe. Britain's dramatic break in diplomatic relations marks the first time that the Syrian Government has paid a price for its activities; it must not be the last. Britain, the United States and their allies should begin a concerted campaign to isolate Syria.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 29, 1986
description: The Economy

title: COCA-COLA BOTTLING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes income from discontinued operations of $25,000 and $479,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and a $2,824,000 gain on the sale of discontinued operations for both the quarter and 9 months.

title: AQUINO ADVISERS DISCUSS STRATEGY
description: With President Corazon C. Aquino and Defense Minister Juan Ponce Enrile on a seeming collision course, some of Mrs. Aquino's advisers said today that they were meeting to seek ways to counter the vigorous political attacks of Mr. Enrile.

title: GUARANTY NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes capital gains of $68,000 and $1,511,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and tax credits of $688,000 for the quarter and $3,092,000 for the 9 months. c-Includes capital gains of $64,000 for the quarter and $1,173,000 for the 9 months.

title: METS FULFILL MISSION
description: Dave Johnson left last night for Japan and one more horizon to cross as manager of a touring all-star baseball team. But the master of the Mets has never sighted any horizon more clearly, nor crossed one more resolutely, than the one he fixed as his goal last February.

title: QMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
U.S. AND SOVIET WEIGH EXCHANGE OF BROADCASTS
description: The United States and the Soviet Union have been holding high-level talks in an attempt to negotiate an unusual exchange of radio programs.

title: FRENCH CULTURE MINISTER FINDS EMPATHY IN U.S.
description: On his first visit to the United States since his appointment as France's Minister of Culture and Communications, Francois Leotard said he was ''not in agreement with the political expressions'' of his controversial predecessor, Jack Lang.

title: Claire Shulman for Queens
description: Voters in Queens must elect a candidate to serve out the remaining term of Donald Manes, the late Borough President. Claire Shulman, the Democratic incumbent, was designated by the City Council in March to fill the post until the end of this year.

title: CONDON'S PRIZZIS TURN INTO A SERIES
description: Richard Condon, who created the darkly comic Prizzi mob and manipulated their minds, businesses and love affairs in his novel and film ''Prizzi's Honor,'' now examines their roots in his latest novel, ''Prizzi's Family.'' What's more, he said in New York the other day, his fictional Prizzis are turning into a series of books.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: MUSICAL BIOGRAPHY The premiere, in concert version, of a musical about the life of Theodor Herzl, the 19th-century Austro-Hungarian critic and newspaperman whose vision established political Zionism and laid the foundations for the state of Israel, will be held tonight at 8:30 in the sanctuary of the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, at Amsterdam Avenue and 111th Street.

title: Chrysler-Maserati
description: The Chrysler Corporation has increased its stake in Maserati S.p.A. to 15.6 percent, from 3.5 percent, with the purchase of $33 million in the Italian luxury car maker's stock, Chrysler said. Howard Chase, Maserati corporate counsel and vice president in New York, said Chrysler had an option to increase its equity to 48 percent by buying out the Italian Government's interest for about $36 million and then to 51 percent by adding a stake held by De Tomaso Industries. Maserati is making a luxury sports coupe for Chrysler, code-named the Q car, which will retail for about $30,000 and will be available early in the 1988 model year, which begins next fall.

title: HOME FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN OF SAN FRANCISCO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company went public in June.

title: FOES SEE P.L.O. GAIN IN LEBANON
description: Leaders of Lebanese Moslem and leftist militias said today that Palestinian guerrillas loyal to Yasir Arafat had made major progress in re-establishing a military presence in southern Lebanon.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an editing error, a report in the Business People column yesterday about the resignation of the chief executive of the Hartmarx Corporation characterized the company's performance incorrectly. The fiscal year ending Nov. 30 will be the first in a decade in which the company's earnings have decreased. The company is not expected to report a loss.

title: They Who Are Very Careful What They Say
description: Fifty years ago Secretary of State Cordell Hull would meet every day at noon with the dozen or so reporters then assigned to cover the State Department. They would sit on big black couches and discuss the issues of the day. In that smaller, more relaxed Washington, Hull was his own spokesman.

title: COMPUTER SCIENCES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 26
description: The company said the share earnings for the latest quarter and 6 months reflect the July 1986 conversion into common stock of its former convertible debenture issue.

title: ENSERCH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income c-Net loss and after a charge of $69.4 million for writedowns of assets. There were no share earnings for the latest 9-month because net did not cover preferred dividend requirements.

title: HAMPTON INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
RED SOX RAN THE GAMUT
description: They were looking back and looking forward, recalling the misery of their earlier defeats and already speaking about next spring. Emotions were mixed; the Boston Red Sox were unsure whether to cry or create hopeful images.

title: PHILADELPHIA ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
PACIFIC INLAND BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After tax credits of $3,400 for the quarter and $205,700 for the 9 months. c-Net loss

title: Capital Cities Earnings Fall
description: Capital Cities/ABC Inc. said yesterday that its third-quarter earnings dropped 44.9 percent to $18.4 million, or $1.13 a share, from $33.4 million, or $2.55 a share, a year ago.

title: Cat Ordinance Adopted
description: This southern New Jersey community, which had considered limiting to three the number of cats a homeowner may possess, has passed an ordinance subjecting cats to the same controls as dogs.

title: A Raising of Federal Court Fees
description: Tucked away in the huge Government spending bill that the 99th Congress passed just before adjourning was a source of new revenue so modest as to be all but invisible: the doubling of the fee for filing civil cases in the Federal courts.

title: IN SOMBER CEREMONY, MOZAMBIQUE BURIES ITS LEADER
description: President Samora M. Machel, killed in a plane crash in South Africa a week ago, was buried here today in emotional ceremonies attended by tens of thousands of people.

title: KEY ROLE REPORTED IN SPYING INQUIRY
description: A veteran of the Central Intelligence Agency provided critical information that enabled prosecutors to file criminal charges against Edward Lee Howard, a former C.I.A. agent who recently defected to the Soviet Union, according to a forthcoming article.

title: KOSS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After net from discontinued operations of $39,600 and a tax credit of $291,600.

title: NEW AIDS DEFINITION ASKED
description: Researchers say the Government's definition of AIDS excludes many people who almost certainly have the disease under a proposal for a new definition.

title: IU INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a tax credit of $3,819,000. c-Net loss and includes losses from discontinued operations of $534,000 for the quarter and $45,022,000 for the 9 months. d-After a gain of $25,038,000 from the sale of some operations, a tax credit of $33,599,000 and a gain of $1,787,000 from an accounting change.

title: BANCTEXAS GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income There were no per share earnings in the year-ago quarter because of preferred dividend requirements.

title: KENJI OSANO
description: Kenji Osano, a confidant of former Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka who was convicted of perjury in connection with the Lockheed payoff scandal, died of an ulcer Monday at Toranomon Hospital, doctors said. He was 69 years old.

title: CAPITAL CITIES/ABC INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $14,250,000 from the settlement litigation for both the quarter and 9 months, and the 9 months also includes an extraordinary gain of $279,996,000 from the sale of broadcast properties and cable TV systems related to the acquisition of ABC. The company said the 1986 results included the operations of American Broadcasting Cos., acquired on Jan. 3. The company said the results for the latest 9-month reflect preliminary estimates of the fair market values assigned to ABC's assets. The company estimated that adjustments related to the determination of the fair market value of entertainment programming and sports rights at the ABC Television Network benefitted earnings in the latest 9 months by about $3.10 a share. The results also includes a charge of $2.50 a share for the amortization of intangibles arising from the ABC acquisition.

title: S.E.C. Faults 'Poison Pill'
description: ''Poison pills,'' the shareholder rights plans adopted by public companies to protect them from hostile takeovers, are harmful to the shareholders they are intended to protect, according to a study released today by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Cummins Engines Is Planning Cuts
description: The Cummins Engine Company said it plans to reduce its worldwide workforce by 3,000, or 16.6 percent, and to consolidate operations over the next two years, resulting in a $134.9 million pre-tax charge in the third quarter.

title: O'Grady Drops Suit
description: Mac O'Grady, the pro golfer, has withdrawn his $12 million suit against the PGA Tour and Commissioner Deane Beman.

title: GENERAL DATACOMM INDUSRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes a one-time, pre-tax gain of $3,975,000 for both the quarter and year from a payment by Digital Communications Associates Inc. and tax credits of $1,685,000 for the quarter and $2,448,000 for the year.

title: A Ferraro Car Is Stolen
description: A car belonging to Geraldine A. Ferraro, the former United States Representative and Democratic Vice Presidential candidate in 1984, was stolen early yesterday morning from outside her home in Forest Hills, Queens, the police said. The car, a gray 1982 Oldsmobile sedan, was stolen between 1 and 7 A.M. from in front of Ms. Ferraro's home, said Detective John Clifford, a police spokesman. Officers from the 112th Precinct are investigating.

title: Putnam's Names Publisher
description: G. P. Putnam's Sons has named Christine Schillig publisher, the president of the publishing house, Phyllis Grann, announced yesterday. Ms. Schillig, formerly vice president and associate publisher of the company, replaces Ms. Grann. Neil S. Nyren, a senior editor, has been named vice president and editor in chief.

title: MARYLAND EXPECTED TO SHIFT DRIESELL
description: Charles (Lefty) Driesell will reportedly announce Wednesday morning that he will leave his job as basketball coach at the University of Maryland to become an assistant athletic director.

title: HOWARD SAVINGS BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
In the Soviet Employ
description: The State Department warned Moscow last week that the Soviet withdrawal of 260 Russian employees from United States diplomatic missions in the Soviet Union would result in ''equal and reciprocal restrictions'' against Americans who work for the Soviet Embassy in Washington.

title: JOHNSON'S 'WINNING' WAY
description: When the Mets' manager, Davey Johnson, was negotiating his current three-year contract nearly a year ago, a World Series bonus was mentioned.

title: AARON RENTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
2 Hurt in Fire At Indian Pt.
description: Two workers at the Indian Point nuclear power plant suffered burns yesterday in a fire that flared up as they searched for a hydrogen leak in a nonnuclear part of the plant, according to a Consolidated Edison Company spokesman.

title: U.S. PRESSES JAPAN ON AUTO PARTS
description: The Reagan Administration, in two days of talks here this week, has renewed its call to the Japanese to redress a $5 billion deficit with the United States in auto parts trade.

title: 'PSYCHOLOGY' KEPT FIELD SAFE AT SHEA
description: Top New York police officials said yesterday that psychology had played a key role in keeping the Mets victory party safe.

title: CROSSLAND SAVINGS FSB reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes a pre-tax gain of $80.6 million on the sale of a mortgage banking subsidiary in August 1985. The company went public in October 1985.

title: CONSUMER TASTES AND U.S. AID SPUR FISH FARM BOOM
description: THE CLEAR SPRINGS TROUT COMPANY in Buhl, Idaho, is developing a fish without bones. Coast Oyster near Seattle plans to sell a cultured sterile oyster this summer that, because it cannot spawn, never gets soft or milky.

title: 'I Didn't Say That'
description: Being the State Department spokesman involves considerably more than simply answering press inquiries or reading official announcements at the daily noon briefing.

title: THEATER: 'TAKING STEPS,' BY ALAN AYCKBOURN
description: ALL fans of the Alan Ayckbourn oeuvre are herewith heartily advised to hasten to the York Theater, where a 1980 offering by the prolific British playwright is enjoying a knockabout New York premiere. The title, ''Taking Steps,'' may refer to the stairs on which the characters keep climbing and descending to outlying parts of the drafty, dusty old house that accommodates their frenetic comings and goings. Since James Morgan's witty set does not include any real stairs, the actors have to do a lot of pretending. Their running or ascending gag sets the footloose pace for the production, which, under Alex Dmitriev's snappy direction, keeps kicking up its heels.

title: A President For MGM/UA
description: Stephen D. Silbert, a senior partner in one of Los Angeles's top law firms, has been appointed to the new post of president and chief operating officer of the MGM/UA Communications Company.

title: WRIGLEY, WM JR CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid in April.

title: More Important Role Seen for Black Viewers
description: Batten, Barton, Durstine and Osborne has released a new study concluding that black viewers will play a greater role in determining network TV programming in the next five years.

title: CONSOLIDATED EDISON OF N Y INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Influenza Vaccine
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION:

title: LYDALL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
STANDARD PACIFIC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
'WHO?' SOME DONORS HADN'T HEARD OF CANDIDATES
description: William F. Alcock is listed in a Federal campaign report as contributing $10 this year to the Senate campaign of James Santini, Republican of Nevada.

title: Taxable Municipal Gets Bids From 23 Dealers
description: Securities dealers' fascination with taxable municipal bonds was high enough to attract 23 separate bids for a $9 million financing yesterday by the Arlington Property Finance Authority of Texas.

title: INTERNATIONAL SHIPHOLDING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Parole Panel Rejects Bid by Convicted Judge
description: The United States Parole Commission today denied a parole request by former Judge Harry E. Claiborne, who was removed from the bench earlier this month when the Senate convicted him of ''high crimes and misdemeanors.''

title: NO TIME FOR GIANTS TO LET UP
description: While the Giants and the Washington Redskins were warming up for Monday night's game here, Coach Bill Parcells of the Giants was chatting with Richie Petitbon, the Redskins' defensive coordinator.

title: Johns Hopkins Students Set Referendum Deadline
description: Students at Johns Hopkins University who were protesting the South African government's policy of racial separation today set a noon Wednesday deadline on demands for a referendum on whether the school's board of trustees should divest the school of some $70 million in stock in companies operating in South Africa.

title: DEFENDERS END FIRST SERIES
description: The four Australian syndicates seeking to defend the America's Cup finished their first trial series here today.

title: VOICEMAIL INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Sikh in Gandhi's Party Is Killed in Punjab
description: A senior Sikh leader of Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi's party and eight other people were killed today in the Punjab as separatists stepped up their campaign of violence, the authorities said.

title: TRANSITWAY TO FOLLOW THE HUDSON
description: State officials today announced plans for the first new rail line in the New York metropolitan region in half a century.

title: SPORTS TODAY
description: HOCKEY DEVILS VS. PENGUINS, at Pittsburgh, 7:30 P.M. (Television - SportsChannel, ESPN 7:30 P.M. Radio - WMCA 570, 7:30 P.M.) RANGERS VS. BLUES, at St. Louis, 8:30 P.M. (Television - Channel 9, 8:30 P.M.) OTHER EVENTS HARNESS RACING: Roosevelt, 8 P.M. SOCCER: Marist vs. L.I.U. (Television -Channel 25, 10 P.M., tape) THOROUGHBRED RACING: Aqueduct, 12:30 P.M. (Television - SportsChannel, 6:15 P.M. and 11:15 P.M.) Meadowlands, 8 P.M. (Television - MSG, midnight)

title: SAN-BAR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
CINCINNATI GAS & ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Market, Chasing Rumors, Rises a Bit
description: Wall Street enjoyed another small gain yesterday, but the session was mainly uneventful as investors ignored such usually important factors as economic projections and stayed riveted again to gossip about takeovers.

title: PAR TECHNOLOGY reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
PRIEST IS GIVING UP HIS SEARCH FOR MISSING ISRAELI
description: An Anglican priest from Australia who is searching for a missing Israeli nuclear technician said today that he was leaving Israel.

title: A Time to Look Alert
description: No Presidential nominees will have to seek confirmation from the Senate until the new Congress meets in January, but a little sage counsel on how to handle that ordeal is always in order. William P. Rogers, who won confirmation as Attorney General and, later, Secretary of State, recalled the other day the advice he gave Potter Stewart upon his nomination for the Supreme Court.

title: Shultz the Spectator
description: Secretaries of State are usually regarded as so permanently attached to their striped pants and diplomatic niceties as to be immune to the lure of sporting events.

title: QUEENS PROSECUTORS SAID TO SEEK A SUSPECT'S HELP
description: Law-enforcement authorities hope to gain information about corruption from Michael A. Nussbaum, a politically active public relations executive indicted in the cable-television investigation in Queens, according to people familiar with the inquiry.

title: HOME FEDERAL SAVINGS BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company went public October 1985.

title: Real Estate; Building Is Geared To Wall St.
description: WHEN the United States Bureau of the Mint put its Assay Office in lower Manhattan up for sale in 1983, HRO International, a real estate development company, emerged from a field of 15 bidders to pay $27 million for the property.

title: Striking Musicians Reject Offer
description: Freelance orchestra musicians have rejected what a consortium of 11 orchestras has called its ''final offer'' to end the musicians' two-week-old strike. The vote, carried out over a 24-hour period ending late yesterday afternoon at Local 802 of the American Federation of Musicians, was 264 to 31, a union spokesman said.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: General Dynamics Corp., St. Louis, said it had hired First Boston Corp. to seek a buyer for Datagraphix, a San Diego subsidiary that makes computer output microfilm equipment and high-speed non-impact page printers.

title: OREGON METALLURGICAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Israel Bonds Honor Wagner
description: Former Mayor Robert F. Wagner was honored by the Israel Bond Organization at a dinner held last night at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel.

title: UNIONS GAIN AN AVERAGE OF 1.6% IN CONTRACTS WON OVER SUMMER
description: Led by gains for telephone and construction workers, first-year wage and benefit increases in major union contracts negotiated over the summer averaged 1.6 percent, the Labor Department reported today.

title: DIAMOND CRYSTAL SALT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $582,000 from the adoption of FASB 87.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * AMP Inc., Harrisburg, Pa., a maker of electric wire terminals and circuitry, elected James E. Marley president, succeeding Harold A. McInnes, who was elected vice chairman. It also elected Benjamin Savidge chief financial officer and vice president.

title: Woman Dies in Crash Of Seaplane Near Island
description: A woman was killed and 12 people were injured today when a seaplane plunged into the sea.

title: The Bets? Hedged
description: Game 7 hadn't been over for 45 minutes, and already parking-lot businessmen were spread out around Shea Stadium, hawking black-and-white team posters of the ''World Champion New York Mets.'' A bit of precipitous entrepreneurship that just happened to go right? Not exactly. On the other side of the poster was a team picture of the ''World Champion Boston Red Sox.''

title: New York Needs That Environmental Bond and Can Afford It
description: To the Editor:

title: Tribute to Pepper Adams
description: The Highlights in Jazz series at New York University will present a tribute to the saxophonist and clarinetist Park (Pepper) Adams, who died last month, tomorrow at 8 P.M. The tribute concert will feature Clark Terry, Joe Morello, Ray Barretto, Junior Mance, Rufus Reid, Joey Cavaseno, Cecil Payne, Nick Brignola and Ronnie Cuber.

title: Out of Star Wars And Back to Earth
description: When the Administration's projected ''disinformation'' program for Libya was exposed, the press and public reacted with shocked surprise.

title: SMALL BREWERIES ENJOYING A REVIVAL
description: FORTY years ago this small town 90 miles north of San Francisco marked the center of a region supported by the cultivation of hops, which give beer its bitter taste and flowery aroma. Today, the only hop plants in town grace the arbor behind the Mendocino Brewing Company's Hopland Brewery, the first brewpub in California since Prohibition was enacted in 1920. It is also in the vanguard of a nationwide rebirth of small breweries.

title: DINING OUT IN THE STRATOSPHERE: TRACKING TOP PRICES IN TOWN
description: THE prices at New York City's choice restaurants seem to soar skyward relentlessly. Not only have the usually expensive a la carte dishes gone up, so have the old reliable prix fixe menus, long a standby for modest wallets. How high is high? What menus and dishes serve as barometers of today's rising costs?

title: TICKER-TAPE PARADES: WHICH WERE BIGGEST?
description: Thousands of tons of paper have descended on the heads of heroes since Theodore Roosevelt was honored in 1910 in the first ticker-tape parade up Broadway from Battery Park to City Hall.

title: INDIAN HEAD BANKS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $1.6 million from the writedown of assets.

title: QUESTAR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes a $9,762,000 after-tax writedown of oil and gas properties. c-Net income and includes investment tax credits of $1,600,000 that are no longer available. The company attributed the latest quarter loss to reduced natural gas demand and declining energy prices.

title: GLENFED INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $1,283,000 from the prepayment of a bank board advance. c-Includes a tax credit of $5,816,000.

title: SPS TECHNOLOGIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes a non-recurring charge of $460,000 from the sale of the company's South African subsidiary.

title: Julienne of Orange Rind
description: A QUICK, simple way to add zest, literally and figuratively, to such fall dishes as roast duck, stews and casseroles is by adding julienne of orange rind - also known as orange zest. Zests also can be candied by cooking them briefly in white-sugar syrup.

title: CHEVRON CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the latest 9-month earnings have been reduced by a $90 million net charge relating to the its manpower reduction program. This net charge consisted of $107 million in direct costs, reduced by $17 million in curtailment gains resulting from the effects of this special program on the company's pension plan. The company said the 1985 periods were affected by several non-recurring items which decreased earnings by $13 million in the third quarter and increased earnings by $38 million in the 9 months. The company's adoption of two new pension accounting standards, effective January 1, 1986, reduced third quarter and 9 months pension expenses by $24 million and $72 million, respectively. The latest quarter and 9-month earnings included foreign exchange gains of $57 million and $65 million, respectively, compared to losses of $29 million and $16 million in the comparable 1985 periods.

title: KEY RATES
RECITAL: JOY BLACKETT, MEZZO
description: JOY BLACKETT'S Sunday evening recital at Alice Tully Hall, accompanied by Lawrence Skrobacs, had much to commend it. Ms. Blackett has a distinctive mezzo-soprano voice, neither small nor large, of an unusually affecting timbre. It is not always an even voice and is possessed of a marked throb; moreover, Ms. Blackett's diction is often indistinct.

title: WILLIAMS INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
Federal Judge Leaving Bench
description: Judge Herbert J. Stern, who has served 13 years in Federal District Court here, announced yesterday that he was resigning from the bench.

title: In Southern Annals
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION:

title: An Upstate Swiss Team Title Was a First for Two Winners
description: The Swiss team events that customarily wind up regional championships are nearly always won by a group of experienced experts adding to a large collection of titles.

title: FEDDERS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes tax credits of $540,000 for the quarter and $2,447,000 for the 9 months. c-Includes tax credits of $156,000 and $1,818,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. The company said its earnings in the latest 9-month included income from an insurance settlement of $1,160,000.

title: Some Advice for Bankers
description: Robert L. Clarke, the nation's Comptroller of the Currency, says bankers are partly to blame for the continuation of regulatory obstacles that they say hinder their competitiveness.

title: STANHOME INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes pre-tax gains of $105,000 in the latest quarter and $421,000 in the year-ago quarter on exchange gains and also includes pre-tax gains of $329,000 in the latest quarter and $119,000 in the year-ago quarter on the sale of assets. c-Includes pre-tax gains of $422,000 in the latest 9 months and $804,000 in the year-ago 9 months on exchange gains and also includes pre-tax gains of $385,000 in the latest 9 months and $271,000 in the year-ago 9 months on the sale of assets. d-Includes a pre-tax restructuring charge of $333,000. Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid in September.

title: WESTON, ROY F INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
People
description: * Stephen Badenhop has been named senior vice president, account services; Robert E. Moorman, senior vice president, management supervisor; Larry Raffle, senior vice president, treasurer, and Peter Cohen, senior vice president, broadcast production at Jordan, Manning, Case, Taylor & McGrath.

title: Petersen Sets His Pace
description: At the age of 26 and with five creditable marathons run over the last three years, Pat Petersen is his own man when it comes to covering 26 miles 385 yards as quickly as possible.

title: Canker Found in Florida
description: A highly contagious strain of canker disease, a bacteria that defoliates citrus trees and scars the fruit, has been discovered in trees in a residential area on Florida's west coast, state agricultural officials said today. Phyllis Habeck, a spokesman for the State Agriculture Department, said the discovery was made eight and a half miles from another residential outbreak on a nearby island and six miles from an infected commercial grove in Manatee County.

title: No Trade-Balance Help
description: To the Editor:

title: Buckets Are Out, Paint Buckets In
description: If the basketball team at John Carroll University in Cleveland tears up the Presidents' Athletic Conference this season, it may be because when their rivals were practicing, the Blue Streaks were painting a blue streak, or at least a basic white.

title: REVLON PARTLY SETTLES DISPUTE
description: The Revlon Group Inc. has partly settled a yearlong dispute over who should own the Revlon beauty business.

title: Austria Recalls Envoy, Answering Israeli Move
description: Austria is recalling its Ambassador from Israel because of the downgrading of the Israeli diplomatic mission here, Chancellor Franz Vranitzky announced today.

title: AGENDA: Oct. 29, 1986
description: Navy Lands on Staten Island After legislative debate and community protest, the proposed Staten Island home port for the U.S.S. Iowa and her support ships today moves a step closer to reality. New York City will formally transfer title to the Navy of land north of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. Speakers at the ceremony will include Representative Guy V. Molinari and Navy officials. 10 A.M., Wave and Front Streets, Stapleton, Staten Island School for 4-Year-Olds The first New York City-financed classes for 4-year-olds begin at 14 elementary schools in 6 community school districts. More than 1,100 places have been set aside in the pilot program, which is part of a Board of Education effort to make public pre-kindergarten instruction available to all of the city's more than 100,000 4-year-olds by 1989. Enrollment is still open. Replacing the Coliseum

FIRST FEDERAL SAVINGS BANK OF CALIFORNIA reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: All per share earnings are after 3-for-2 stock splits declared Aug. 22, 1985 and June 19, 1986.

title: Jefferson Had Few Illusions About Judges
description: To the Editor:

title: PENN SAVINGS BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After tax credits of $207,000 for the quarter and $448,000 for the 9 months. The company went public in August 1986.

title: GRAND METROPOLITAN SELLS LIGGETT TO AN IVESTOR
description: Grand Metropolitan P.L.C., the British conglomerate, said yesterday that it had sold the Liggett Group, the smallest of the major tobacco companies, to a New York investor for $137 million.
